creator: pklein@lehman.com
text:
bin/jmeter.bat's last line is 
java -Xincgc -jar ApacheJMeter.jar %JMETER_CMD_LINE_ARGS%

unfortunately, java.dll is in the same directory as java.exe in
Sun's j2sdk1.4.0 release.  As a result, windows gets confused, and 
thinks that the 'java' refered to above is 'java.dll' not 'java.exe'
and fails to execute.

creator: jlewemail@nyc.rr.com
text:
I changed all bat files from java to java.exe.  My JAVA_HOME is set correctly.  

I still get the error:
C:\jakarta-jmeter\bin>CALL ..\lcp.bat ..\lib\ant-1.4.1.jar
***Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:***
Connectors\classes;C
\IBMCON~1\CICS\Classes\CTGCLI~1/JAR;/;//\lib\ant-1/4/1/jar;//\lib\jakarta-ant-1
4/1-optional/jar;//\lib\jakarta-oro-2/0/1/jar;//\lib\junit/jar;//\lib\log4j-cor
/jar;//\lib\log4j/jar;//\lib\rt/jar;//\lib\src/jar;//\lib\Tidy/jar;//\lib\tools
jar;//\lib\util/jar;//\lib\xerces/jar;ApacheJMeter/jar

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text: JMeter 1.7.2 and above doesn't work like that anymore.

Marking all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8's release date as VERIFIED.
Yes, it's pretty poor QA procedure, but there's bugs here lingering since JMeter
1.6, and we need to clean up a little.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
jsalvata@atg.com
text: Bulk-closing all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8 release date.
